articleinfo.title: How to build and run the tutorial

article.para: The tutorial consists of a simple model in ArgoUML format, some test data for this model and a Java program to query the data. It includes the InterMine jar, its dependencies, the necessary configuration files and a build script.
Building the tutorial involves a few simple steps:

listitem.para: Ensure that you have the required software installed, including Tomcat.
Download and unpack the latest InterMine tutorial (intermine-tutorial-xxxxxxxx).

Change to the tutorial root directory, modify the intermine.properties configuration file to reflect your database server name, database user name, and password if necessary. Note that you must run createdb tutorial before attempting to store data.

Depending on your requirements there is a choice of targets that you can run. Issue the command ant help to display user targets or ant -projecthelp for a full target list. ant run will read and store the data, and perform a query to ensure it was stored correctly. The source (src/java/org/intermine/tutorial/SimpleQuery.java) demonstrates how this query is run for the model (model/tutorial/tutorial.zargo). The results, can be compared to the test data (resources/tutorial_data.xml).

If you wish to deploy the web front-end for the tutorial model then first modify the build.properties configuration file ensuring the destination server and path are correct. Then run the ant release-webapp command to release the tutorial web application to the server.
